pkgmetadata.longdescription: The Fill-Mask Association Test // The Fill-Mask Association Test ('FMAT') is an integrative, versatile, and probability-based method that uses Masked Language Models to measure conceptual associations or relations (e.g., attitudes, biases, stereotypes, social norms, cultural values) as propositional representations in natural language. The supported language models include 'BERT' (Devlin et al., 2018) arXiv:1810.04805 and its model variants available at 'Hugging Face' https://huggingface.co/models?pipeline_tag=fill-mask. 'Python' ('conda') environment and the 'transformers' module can be installed automatically using the FMAT_load() function. Methodological references and technical details are provided at https://psychbruce.github.io/FMAT/.
